abstract: Brooklyn steel-pan bands have been forced to hunt for practice space, or 'pan-yards,' as gentrification reduces number of empty lots east of Prospect Park, location of West Indian communities that embrace genre; some band leaders faced with practicing in far flung city corners or disbanding altogether, have approached borough officials for help.
lead_paragraph: Groups like the Pantonic Steel Orchestra are having a difficult time finding so-called pan yards because of rising costs and noise complaints.

headline.main: Steel-Pan Bands in Brooklyn Struggle to Find Rehearsal Space
headline.print_headline: Let’s Practice, if We Can Find a Spot

snippet: Groups like the Pantonic Steel Orchestra are having a difficult time finding so-called pan yards because of rising costs and noise complaints.
